sense.name: press together with a rotating motion, emiting a grating sound
sense.commentary: Note: Must involve production of a sound related to the grinding motion.
sense.examples: He ground his teeth at night whenever he was worried about something. When I put the thing in reverse, the gears were grinding.

sense.name: reduce to small pieces by pounding or abrading
sense.examples: I like to grind my coffee fresh each morning. This mill is easy to use and can grind the nutmeg finely. I had to grind away part of the side of the oil pan to get my fitting to turn. Then they ground out the tree stumps. He ground the cigar with the heel of his boot. His dreams were ground into the dust by society's laws.

sense.name: toil, esp. at studying
sense.examples: But we knew we had to grind away in our first innings and get a lead. He ground away the days in the hospital and classroom, the nights studying. She ground away with a stubborn conscientiousness at mathematics.

sense.name: dance by rotating the pelvis in an erotically suggestive way
sense.examples: This club night is essentially a great excuse for teens to bump and grind on the dance floor.

sense.name: form, polish or create through wearing away with friction
sense.examples: The surf ground and polished the crystals and deposited them on the shore. She ground the lens for the telescope herself. The dentist ground down some of the fillings. Abraham Lincoln once said that if he had six hours to chop down a tree, he'd spend the first four hours grinding the axe.

sense.name: oppress; wear down
sense.examples: He spoke of how Williams had treated them like imbeciles, how he ground down their spirit. He ground down the monks with taxes heavier than those which were extorted from the Jews themselves.

sense.name: produce in a routine and monotonous manner
sense.examples: They ground out the first 80 pages in a single 36-hour session.

sense.name: GRIND TO A HALT: be unable to move further
sense.examples: Central London traffic ground to a halt during Wednesday morning's rush hour.
